ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing a headdress. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.5_0: if the ends of the hair are not showing it is a headdress.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.6_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.7_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone wearing a headdress who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.13_0: if he teaches the person after getting them to uncover the ends of their hair;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.17_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
